skill.name: agent-management
skill.description: Use PROACTIVELY this agent when you need to design and create optimal Claude Code subagents, update existing agents with new capabilities, revise agent configurations, analyze project requirements to identify specialized roles, or craft precise agent configurations with appropriate tool permissions and model tiers. When the user specify "Create or Update subagent [name]", this skill must be triggered.
skill.summary: Use PROACTIVELY this agent when you need to design and create optimal Claude Code subagents, update ...
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: All 111 static alerts evaluated as false positives. Scanner misidentified markdown documentation syntax (code blocks, placeholders, headers) as security threats. No actual shell execution, cryptographic code, or reconnaissance capabilities exist in this skill. This is a pure documentation and template package for Claude Code subagent management.

content.user_title: Create and Manage Claude Code Subagents
content.value_statement: Managing Claude Code subagents requires understanding complex configuration patterns and file structures. This skill provides automated agent creation, configuration validation, and ecosystem management for specialized AI assistants.
actual_capabilities: Creates Claude Code subagent configuration files following template structure
Updates existing subagents while preserving core functionality
Validates YAML frontmatter and required sections are present
Selects appropriate model tier based on task complexity (Haiku, Sonnet, Opus)
Manages temporary git branches for version-controlled agent updates
limitations: Only creates agents in Claude Code format; does not support other agent frameworks
Does not execute agent tasks directly; only generates configurations

use_cases.title: Project Team Lead Creating Specialized Agents
use_cases.description: Design and deploy Claude Code subagents tailored to specific workflows like code review, testing, or documentation generation.

use_cases.title: Developer Managing Agent Ecosystem
use_cases.description: Update existing subagents with new capabilities while ensuring backward compatibility and avoiding conflicts.

use_cases.title: AI Engineer Building Agent Frameworks
use_cases.description: Establish consistent agent patterns across projects by using standardized templates and validation rules.

prompt_templates.title: Create a New Subagent
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new subagent called [agent-name] that specializes in [task-description]. Use Haiku model.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick agent creation with minimal parameters

prompt_templates.title: Create Complex Subagent
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new code-reviewer subagent with sonnet model. It should have 3 core responsibilities: security analysis, code quality review, and documentation verification. Each responsibility should have 5 detailed tasks.
prompt_templates.scenario: Detailed agent specification with full workflow

prompt_templates.title: Update Existing Subagent
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the existing test-runner agent to add fail-fast capability and improve error reporting. Preserve all existing functionality.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk Agent Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all existing subagents in .claude/agents and identify any that have overlapping responsibilities or missing success criteria.

output_examples.input: Create a new subagent called database-expert that handles SQL queries, schema migrations, and performance optimization.
output: Core Responsibilities: 3 (SQL Query Optimization, Schema Management, Performance Tuning)

output_examples.input: Update the code-reviewer agent to add security vulnerability detection.
output: Added: Security Analysis responsibility with 5 tasks
Validated: YAML frontmatter, all sections present

best_practices: Start with Claude-generated agent templates, then customize to your specific needs
Limit each subagent to 3 core responsibilities with 5 tasks each for focused behavior
Use minimal tool permissions - only grant tools the agent strictly needs
Version control project subagents so your team can collaborate on improvements
anti_patterns: Creating catch-all agents that handle too many unrelated responsibilities
Granting all available tools to every subagent without restriction
Skipping validation of YAML frontmatter before deploying agents
Modifying subagents directly without using version-controlled branches

faq.question: What is the difference between project and user subagents?
faq.answer: Project subagents are stored in .claude/agents/ and available only in the current project. User subagents are stored in ~/.claude/agents/ and available across all projects. Project subagents take precedence when names conflict.

faq.question: Which model should I choose for my subagent?
faq.answer: Use Haiku for simple, focused tasks. Choose Sonnet for regular coding tasks. Select Opus for complex planning, reasoning, or multi-step workflows requiring higher intelligence.

faq.question: How do subagents handle tool permissions?
faq.answer: Subagents can inherit all tools from the main conversation, or you can specify a comma-separated list of allowed tools. Use the /agents command to modify tool access interactively.

faq.question: Can subagents access MCP tools?
faq.answer: Yes. When the tools field is omitted, subagents inherit all MCP tools available to the main thread. You can also explicitly list MCP tools in the tools field.

faq.question: How does Claude Code decide when to use a subagent?
faq.answer: Claude Code automatically delegates tasks based on your request description and the description field in subagent configurations. Including phrases like use PROACTIVELY encourages automatic delegation.

faq.question: Should I check subagents into version control?
faq.answer: Yes. Project subagents should be checked into version control so your team can benefit from shared configurations and collaboratively improve them over time.
